result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shannon Mona Potts appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Shannon Mona Potts. State moves to dismiss and read-in to 21CF205; Court so orders.  HE set 3-9-22 removed from the calendar.

Prior: 530 N Main St #514, Oshkosh, WI 54901

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shannon Mona Potts appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Shannon Mona Potts. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.
